concept.title: Moon landings
concept.shortdesc: A moon landing refers to the event when a spacecraft successfully lands on the surface of the Moon.

conbody.p: The most famous moon landing occurred on July 20, 1969, when NASA's Apollo 11 mission, commanded by Neil Armstrong, successfully landed on the Moon. Armstrong and astronaut Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the lunar surface, while Michael Collins remained in orbit around the Moon in the command module.
This article explores the most prominent landings (manned and unmanned) and one of the most important motivations for landings â€“ the quest for water.

note.p: This content was sourced from GenAI.
